Reviews.Title: Worthless for HDTV antenna
Reviews.Author: Paul R. Wickliffe
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to boost the signal strength of my HDTV reception from an attic directional antenna to a Panasonic plasma HCTV.  I live 40 miles West of the transmission towers in the New York area.  Before I inserted the amp into the signal path, I did a survey of what channels I could receive and their signal strength.  I took the same survey after the amp was placed in the signal path.  With the amp in, I lost half my channels and lost signal strength in the remaining channels.  The threads on the type F coax connectors are not properly matched to my cable connectors, so only a couple of turns reached maximum tightness instead of being able to fully screw down the connectors.  I purchased this one because it had an FM trap on it as I am near an FM transmitter.  The trap improved performance, but it was still worse than just using the antenna by itself.

ProductInfo.Name: Philmore UHF/VHF/FM High Gain Distribution Amplifier w/ FM Trap : DA27B
